column4: I have installed ubuntu, and am confronted with the same problem, namely refresh rates. Ubuntu simply puts my refresh rate at mind-hurting low rates. Someone please help me. I did "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg", and set my monitor rates @ (HxV) 31-54x50-99.
And now in screen resolution, i get option for running 800x600 mode @ 86Hz, and the same for 640x480 modes
but whenever i select any of them ubuntu simply takes me back to the login screen
so now i am stuck at 1024x768 @ 61Hz. Someone please help. And now when i scroll any webpages its scrolls extremely slowly. This happened after i ran the reconfigure command
Someone please help
Someone willing to help me?
please?
what kind of graphics card
did you install nvidia-glx?
apt-get install nvidia-glx
no i left it blank
then try again
at the end, select 'medium' instead of advanced
selecting medium doesn't help
so you can select resolutions and refresh rates
and adding the memory size?
And manually entering my VxH refresh rates in "advanced" too doesn't help
agiain: and adding the memory size?
from what i understand people with memory onboard the graphics card (mine has 128mb dedicated GPU memory) are supposed to keep it blank. SO i kept it blank
maybe, but i've got an fx 5200 with no problems up to 1600x1400 or something
but my monitorCRT can't support those resolutions
i simply want 800x600 @ 85Hz. which my monitor supports in Windows. I selected it in reconfiugre..."medium", as well as put the values in "advanced". but that doesn't help

Now, whenever i select 800x600 or 640x480, the screen resolution dialog box says (86Hz), whereas it actually should be 85Hz (my monitor can only support 85hz not more than that, how do i bring the value back to 85hz)
